text.__SUMMARY__: Conus bellacoensis is an extinct species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails, cone shells or cones.
text.Description: The size of the shell grows to a length of 76 mm.
text.Distribution: This marine species is only known as a fossil from the Neogene of the Dominican Republic.
text.References: Hendricks J.R. (2015). Glowing seashells: diversity of fossilized coloration patterns on coral reef-associated cone snail (Gastropoda: Conidae) shells from the Neogene of the Dominican Republic. PLoS ONE. 10(4): e0120924
text.External links: To World Register of Marine Species
